cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northward, expected to turn north-northeast then east-northeast across Mississippi, Alabama and into Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near Morgan City, Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch east of Morgan City LA to Okaloosa/Walton County line FL (northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning East of Morgan City LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line FL, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle, then inland across MS, AL, GA and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible (gusts 20–30 mph) as the weakening system passes inland to the west
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain totaling 2–4 inches possible late Sunday through early Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat inland over central Georgia; very low risk at the coast
